seoDescription.en-US: Page of Amplify site. Contains data about Amplify CRM.

seoOgDescription.en-US: Page of Amplify site. Contains data about Amplify CRM. OG

seoTwitterDescription.en-US: Page of Amplify site. Contains data about Amplify CRM. Twitter

content.value: a CRM can have on your business?

heroHomeSubtitle.en-US: A CRM can amplify your insights, providing new revenue opportunities and workforce efficiencies.

title.en-US: Let’s see where your CRM situation lines up today.

subtitle.en-US: Click the area below that best represents where your business is in its lifecycle to learn more.

tile1Title.en-US: WE’RE LOOKING TO IMPLEMENT OUR FIRST CRM.

tile1Content.en-US: If this is your first time implementing a CRM, we’ll make it simple and walk you through your options.

tile2Title.en-US: WE’RE LOOKING TO SWITCH FROM OUR CURRENT CRM.

tile2Content.en-US: If your toolset is underpowered or you’ve outgrown its purpose, we can introduce you to new capabilities.

tile3Content.en-US: If you’re already using Dynamics 365, let us help you unlock its full potential.

tile4Title.en-US: WE NEED HELP WITH REPORTING AND ANALYTICS.

tile4Content.en-US: Turn your data into insights with in-depth reporting and analytics.

title.en-US: We’re looking to implement our first CRM.

subtitle.en-US: CRM has taken over as the largest software market in the world, with over 91% of companies with more than 11 employees using a CRM system to manage their business and with good reason. A CRM system not only allows you to centralize and secure all your important business and customer data but can act as a singular business management tool that can propel your business to the next level.

question.en-US: What can a CRM bring to my company?

content.value: Centralize emails, phone calls, meetings, and tasks into one system.
Use the latest technology to add consistency and efficiency to your company specific processes.
Start to build consistent and valuable company data for better business decisions.

cmsName.en-US: Home Page: Help With Reporting And Analytics.

title.en-US: We need help with reporting and analytics.

subtitle.en-US: CRM has taken over as the largest software market in the world, with over 91% of companies with more than 11 employees using a CRM system to manage their business and with good reason. A CRM system not only allows you to centralize and secure all your important business and customer data but can act as a singular business management tool that can propel your business to the next level.

content.value: Bring your sales, marketing, service and accounting data together to create centralized reporting.
Set scheduled refresh dates and times, eliminating outdated information, manual updates and static excel reports.
Easily compare month-over-month or year-over-year sales performance, operational efficiency, financial performance and other important KPI’s.
Drill down on reports to investigate the cause of trends or variations in both performance and underperformance.
Create scalable reports with user/role/department specific permissions.
View reports and dashboards directly in Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Teams with direct links to those underlying records.

title.en-US: Partnerships are critical to long-term success.

mainText.en-US: We’re a Microsoft Silver Partner, which means you can trust us with all things Dynamics 365 CRM and Power BI.

secondaryText.en-US: This type of partnership with Microsoft is earned through experience in working with Dynamics 365, Power BI, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, Power Apps, Power Automate and many more Microsoft products!

title.en-US: We believe the fractional approach provides optimal value to our clients.

content.value: Most emerging businesses are focused on maintaining their bottom line costs while challenged with growing and optimizing their revenues with existing resources. The opportunity that technology and tooling provides is intended to unlock new efficiencies that manual process often cannot.

Unfortunately, many small business implementing technologies fall short in realizing the business value that was initially driving their business case. The cost to continue developing the capability can become out of reach for many or uninspiring for others.
We work with companies to cost effectively provide a fractional solution that takes care of optimizing your CRM technology and sales operations through partnership

subtitle.en-US: Fractional CRM has a fit for all.

subtitleContent.en-US: Business of this size need to allocate their staff towards revenue generating activities, while we focus on optimizing their day to day.

buttonCommentText.en-US: New to the fractional CRM approach? Click below to learn more.

testimonial.en-US: Throughout this process I have appreciated having the ability to talk to people that take the time (and have the ability) to understand our business and truly customize our CRM platform to exactly what makes sense for us. Amplify’s knowledge and experience in Dynamics, sales, and business in general, has been hugely valuable throughout this process, mostly because of their ability to apply this expertise to our unique requirements.

Amplify’s knowledge and experience in Dynamics, sales, and business in general, has been hugely valuable throughout this process, mostly because of their ability to apply this expertise to our unique requirements. Throughout this process I have appreciated having the ability to talk to people that take the time (and have the ability) to understand our business and truly customize our CRM platform to exactly what makes sense for us.

Amplify’s knowledge and experience in Dynamics, sales, and business in general, has been hugely valuable throughout this process, mostly because of their ability to apply this expertise to our unique requirements.

Throughout this process I have appreciated having the ability to talk to people that take the time (and have the ability) to understand our business and truly customize our CRM platform to exactly what makes sense for us.

Throughout this process I have appreciated having the ability to talk to people that take the time (and have the ability) to understand our business and truly customize our CRM platform to exactly what makes sense for us. Amplify’s knowledge and experience in Dynamics, sales, and business in general, has been hugely valuable throughout this process, mostly because of their ability to apply this expertise to our unique requirements.

heroSubtitle.en-US: Amplify is unlike any other business solutions provider. The biggest difference? We become a partner.

mainText.en-US: Since 2018, we’ve been working with businesses of all sizes to amplify their sales, margins and satisfaction through the use of customized CRM and business intelligence solutions.

secondaryText.en-US: Our focus is to partner with organizations to simplify the process of setting up and maximizing the potential of Dynamics 365 and Power BI. We build high-end systems and analytics that result in a major competitive advantage for our clients.

tile1Description.en-US: Tailored business technology, made simple and attainable.

tile2Description.en-US: Driving profitability and scalability through the effective implementation and management of technology.

subtitle.en-US: Our advantage is built around finding a flat monthly consulting fee, as opposed to hourly logs and project quotes.

block1Title.en-US: WE’RE NOT JUST PROGRAMMERS, WE’RE ALSO BUSINESSPEOPLE

block1Content.en-US: We take the time to fully understand your business so we can pro-actively suggest ways that Dynamics 365 and Power BI can help you succeed and grow.

block2Title.en-US: WE BELIEVE IN FINDING VALUE TOGETHER

block2Content.en-US: We find a flat monthly fee that fits your business so we can focus on finding value without needing to worry about increased costs or going over budget.

block3Title.en-US: WE’RE AGILE AND FAST WITHOUT SACRIFICING QUALITY

block3Content.en-US: With our approach we have been able to implement and further enhance our clients CRM and Reporting at an industry leading pace.

subtitle.en-US: We want to turn your CRM and Reporting Solutions into a top competitive advantage for your company.

tile1SecondaryText.en-US: We are both business and tech-savvy – we will dive into your business and existing systems, understanding them as you would expect a senior employee to.

tile2SecondaryText.en-US: We will discuss your business and technology goals alongside your budget and available resources, ensuring we are fully aligned on how best to structure development.

tile3SecondaryText.en-US: We have a proprietory built-in tool where you, your staff and our developers can view, suggest and review on-going development together to help identify priorities.

tile4SecondaryText.en-US: Not only will we be there to help your current priorities, we will pro-actively suggest ways your business can take advantage of the latest technology developments.

subtitle.en-US: Could a $50,000 technology investment help your cause?

content.value: Amplify Solutions will donate up to $50,000 in services toward building and supporting a customized CRM platform        and business reporting tool for qualifying small to medium non-profit organizations.
We believe strongly in supporting growing non-profit organizations by providing a foundation on which they can        organize, expand and Amplify the Good they are doing for their communities.
Keep an eye out for announcements on next year’s Amplify the Good and more chances to win!

heroTitle.en-US: Realize the power of proactive data insights.

heroSubtitle.en-US: Start to make data-driven decisions for your business and see the difference for yourself.

title.en-US: Is your business getting the most out of your data?

subtitle.en-US: We specialize in leveraging existing systems and data to create in-depth reporting and analytics that help our clients make better business decisions.

block1Content.en-US: Ensure you are able to flag trends and forecasts in real-time so you can act before it’s too late.

block2Content.en-US: Lead your meetings and reviews with data to get to richer conversations and better decisions.

block3Content.en-US: Connect directly to your data sources to avoid time spent on creating and managing one-off Excel reporting.

title.en-US: Is CRM Really Worth the Investment?

subtitle.en-US: How Small Business Can Realize ROI on a CRM

content.value: If you’ve been looking at deploying a CRM for your business, you may be familiar with some of the widely touted statistics on what kind of impact a CRM implementation can have:

Sounds great! But how are these numbers calculated? Would these industry statistics apply to my small business? How can we actually realize these gains? In this article, I’m going to demonstrate how to evaluate the upside of CRM for your business by walking you through one of the calculations you can use to determine what your ROI on implementing CRM might be and how you can actually realize these gains.

Today we are going to look at Sales Productivity. It is well known that an average salesperson spends 65% of their time on non-revenue generating activity – filling out forms, preparing documents, setting up follow ups, composing, scheduling, and sending on-going communications, liaising between departments during installation or service issues, promoting/advertising new products/services, managing their sales funnel/internal reporting etc. Implementing CRM can drastically reduce this time by:
Centralized Communication to Monitor Last & Next Interactions

A lot of the above can be calculated as a time spent before vs. time spent after the implementation of CRM. Now we said that 65% of a salesperson’s time is spent on non-sales generating activity, which would equate to 26 hours of a typical 40-hour workweek. That said, a CRM is not going to eliminate ALL non-revenue generating activity and we know that even if we could save this much actual working time, it is highly unlikely that it would all be replaced one-to-one with productive time. So, let’s be conservative, and say that with all of the above changes in place, we could save about 5 hours per week per salesperson of administrative time.
This, by itself, results in a (again, conservative) 20% increase in Sales Productivity. Sounds great, but how do we actually realize this gain?
Calculating ROI in a Way it Can be Realized
Using an example of a team of five salespeople making $60,000 per year, this 20% increase in Sales Productivity could either result in:
– You are able to grow your sales revenue by an additional 20% before you need to hire your next salesperson. The realized return would then be $60,000 per year.
– You are able to handle your current sales volume with four salespeople instead of five. The realized return would then be $60,000 per year.

Either way, the realized return is $60,000 per year. This is not just a one-time savings, this is an ongoing savings, which will compound as you grow your business and sales team. How can we quantify this? From a business valuation perspective, small businesses typically use a 15% discount rate to determine the value of a ongoing return – the total realized savings of this 20% Increase in Sales Productivity would therefore be $400,000.00 ($60,000.00 / 0.15).

If you were to invest $40,000 on implementing and developing a CRM system to achieve this, you’d be looking at a 10X return on your CRM Investment from the perspective of just one single aspect, Sales Productivity. It is now easy to understand (and believe) how the average ROI for CRM is reported to be 871% once you factor in all the other areas of your business.

Ensuring you see these results is not quite as simple and immediate as deploying an available CRM and providing access – if deployed where it does not fit your business you can often hurt your Sales Productivity. To get proper results finding a partner who understands your business so that the features and functionality of your system are tailored exactly to your business and operations is key. Amplify Solutions specializes in CRM for Small Business – we take the time to truly understand our customers’ business first and build custom solutions that perform. Give us a call to find out more about what we can do for your business.

That said, a CRM is not going to eliminate ALL non-revenue generating activity and we know that even if we could save this much actual working time, it is highly unlikely that it would all be replaced one-to-one with productive time. This, by itself, results in a (again, conservative) 20% increase in Sales Productivity. Sounds great, but how do we actually realize this gain?
Calculating ROI in a Way it Can be Realized
Using an example of a team of five salespeople making $60,000 per year, this 20% increase in Sales Productivity could either result in:
– You are able to grow your sales revenue by an additional 20% before you need to hire your next salesperson. The realized return would then be $60,000 per year.
– You are able to handle your current sales volume with four salespeople instead of five. The realized return would then be $60,000 per year.

Either way, the realized return is $60,000 per year. This is not just a one-time savings, this is an ongoing savings, which will compound as you grow your business and sales team. How can we quantify this? From a business valuation perspective, small businesses typically use a 15% discount rate to determine the value of a ongoing return – the total realized savings of this 20% Increase in Sales Productivity would therefore be $400,000.00 ($60,000.00 / 0.15).

If you were to invest $40,000 on implementing and developing a CRM system to achieve this, you’d be looking at a 10X return on your CRM Investment from the perspective of just one single aspect, Sales Productivity. It is now easy to understand (and believe) how the average ROI for CRM is reported to be 871% once you factor in all the other areas of your business.

Ensuring you see these results is not quite as simple and immediate as deploying an available CRM and providing access – if deployed where it does not fit your business you can often hurt your Sales Productivity. To get proper results finding a partner who understands your business so that the features and functionality of your system are tailored exactly to your business and operations is key. Amplify Solutions specializes in CRM for Small Business – we take the time to truly understand our customers’ business first and build custom solutions that perform. Give us a call to find out more about what we can do for your business.

title.en-US: Analytics provides the ability to be pro-active about your business activities.

subtitle.en-US: Power BI helps to…

feature1Content.en-US: Bring your sales, marketing, service and accounting data together to create centralized reporting.

feature2Content.en-US: Set scheduled refresh dates and times, eliminating outdated information, manual updates and static excel reports

feature3Content.en-US: Easily compare month-over-month or year-over-year sales performance, operational efficiency, financial performance and other important KPI’s.

feature4Content.en-US: Connect directly to your raw data source to limit time spent on updating and reconciling your reports.

feature5Title.en-US: SET PERMISSIONS AND SECURITIES TO SCALE REPORTS

feature5Content.en-US: Create scalable reports with user/ role/department specific permissions.

feature6Content.en-US: Drill down on reports to investigate the cause of trends or variations in both performance and underperformance.

title.en-US: Want to see Power BI in action?

content.en-US: Power BI is feature-rich data mashup and report authoring tool that helps you understand data quality and formatting issues.

heroSubtitle.en-US: The power of a CRM is its ability to curate the patterns and insights that align with its target audience.

subtitle1.en-US: CRM is more than just software or a set of processes – it’s a business culture solidly focused on winning and keeping the right customers.

contentText1.en-US:
A good CRM solution builds value for your business by opening up vital communication channels and creating a common client-focused knowledge-base to better serve your clients. 

CRM has taken over as the largest software market in the world, with over 91% of companies with more than 11 employees using a CRM system to manage their business and with good reason.A CRM system not only allows you to centralize and secure all your important business and customer data but can act as a singular business management tool that can propel your business to the next level.

contentText2.en-US: CRM is more than just software or a set of processes – it’s a business culture solidly focused on winning and keeping the right customers. A good CRM solution builds value for your business by opening up vital communication channels and creating a common client-focused knowledge-base to better serve your clients

subtitle.en-US: We look to partner and grow with each of our clients, we like to be thought of as a “Fractional CRM Department”.

content.en-US: The impacts of a high functioning CRM are substantial. But getting there is not easy as evident in the industry report that 49% of CRM projects fail. We have found an approach that has lead to overwhelming satisfaction at a discounted cost.

leftBlockContent.en-US: We structure our partnership so we can dive in with our clients and proactively work together.

rightBlockContent.en-US: We only work on a flat consulting fee so there is less time on quotes, proposals, and approvals… And more time on development.

centerBlockContent.en-US: In an industry known to have a steep price and poor success rates, our approach has lead to a flawless success rate at a discount.

subtitle.en-US: A CRM platform helps companies target different audiences, set scores and alerts based on an individual lead or customer’s activity, proactively work with contacts, and maintain relationships. Best of all, a CRM system can be used across departments to ensure that all customer-facing teams are empowered with the right data to create incredible customer experiences.

mainText.en-US: Microsoft is the only vendor that provides hardware, software, and internet-of-things (IoT) platforms to enable end-to-end customer service.

content.value: Dynamics 365 is a collection of intelligent business applications that work together to run your business within one unified platform, helping drive consistency and efficiency.

Dynamics 365 is scalable – while it continues to excel in its core areas of sales process management and finance it also provides exceptional marketing, service, human resource and operations applications as well that can be layered in to create a complete business management solution.

title.en-US: Advantages of Having a Strong CRM

advantages1Content.en-US: Reach consistency and avoid missed follow-ups by centralizing your communication.

advantages2Content.en-US: Build you company specific processes to help automate notifications, task assignment, approvals, administrative work, and document creation.

advantages3Content.en-US: A central system for Sales, Service, Marketing, Operations and Management to streamline your inter-department collaboration and work.

advantages4Content.en-US: Begin to segment and group your Prospects and Clients, allowing for system checks and notifications to help proactively manage your relationships.

advantages5Content.en-US: Through your custom processes and required fields you can begin to build valuable and accurate data on your business.

advantages6Content.en-US: Leverage your company data to build in-depth reporting for better business insights and decisions.

subtitle.en-US: Since 2018, we’ve been working with businesses of all sizes to amplify their sales, margins and satisfaction through the use of customized CRM and business intelligence solutions.

address.en-US: 200-1460 Chevrier Blvd. Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Y6 Canada

heroSubtitle.en-US: If you are interested in amplifying your business’ potential with through CRM or analytics, it all starts here.

thankYouContent.en-US: We appreciate your consideration. We will be in touch as soon as we can.

addressValue.en-US: 200-1460 Chevrier Blvd., Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Y6 Canada

title.en-US: Is CRM Really Worth the Investment? (6)

subtitle.en-US: How Small Business Can Realize ROI on a CRM

content.value: If you’ve been looking at deploying a CRM for your business, you may be familiar with some of the widely touted statistics on what kind of impact a CRM implementation can have:

Sounds great! But how are these numbers calculated? Would these industry statistics apply to my small business? How can we actually realize these gains? In this article, I’m going to demonstrate how to evaluate the upside of CRM for your business by walking you through one of the calculations you can use to determine what your ROI on implementing CRM might be and how you can actually realize these gains.

Today we are going to look at Sales Productivity. It is well known that an average salesperson spends 65% of their time on non-revenue generating activity – filling out forms, preparing documents, setting up follow ups, composing, scheduling, and sending on-going communications, liaising between departments during installation or service issues, promoting/advertising new products/services, managing their sales funnel/internal reporting etc. Implementing CRM can drastically reduce this time by:
Centralized Communication to Monitor Last & Next Interactions

A lot of the above can be calculated as a time spent before vs. time spent after the implementation of CRM. Now we said that 65% of a salesperson’s time is spent on non-sales generating activity, which would equate to 26 hours of a typical 40-hour workweek. That said, a CRM is not going to eliminate ALL non-revenue generating activity and we know that even if we could save this much actual working time, it is highly unlikely that it would all be replaced one-to-one with productive time. So, let’s be conservative, and say that with all of the above changes in place, we could save about 5 hours per week per salesperson of administrative time.
This, by itself, results in a (again, conservative) 20% increase in Sales Productivity. Sounds great, but how do we actually realize this gain?
Calculating ROI in a Way it Can be Realized
Using an example of a team of five salespeople making $60,000 per year, this 20% increase in Sales Productivity could either result in:
– You are able to grow your sales revenue by an additional 20% before you need to hire your next salesperson. The realized return would then be $60,000 per year.
– You are able to handle your current sales volume with four salespeople instead of five. The realized return would then be $60,000 per year.

Either way, the realized return is $60,000 per year. This is not just a one-time savings, this is an ongoing savings, which will compound as you grow your business and sales team. How can we quantify this? From a business valuation perspective, small businesses typically use a 15% discount rate to determine the value of a ongoing return – the total realized savings of this 20% Increase in Sales Productivity would therefore be $400,000.00 ($60,000.00 / 0.15).

If you were to invest $40,000 on implementing and developing a CRM system to achieve this, you’d be looking at a 10X return on your CRM Investment from the perspective of just one single aspect, Sales Productivity. It is now easy to understand (and believe) how the average ROI for CRM is reported to be 871% once you factor in all the other areas of your business.

Ensuring you see these results is not quite as simple and immediate as deploying an available CRM and providing access – if deployed where it does not fit your business you can often hurt your Sales Productivity. To get proper results finding a partner who understands your business so that the features and functionality of your system are tailored exactly to your business and operations is key. Amplify Solutions specializes in CRM for Small Business – we take the time to truly understand our customers’ business first and build custom solutions that perform. Give us a call to find out more about what we can do for your business.

contactUsSubtitle.en-US: Like what you’re seeing? Get in touch with us so we can talk about amplifying your business.

content.value: a CRM can have on your business?

heroHomeSubtitle.en-US: A CRM can amplify your insights, providing new revenue opportunities and workforce efficiencies.

heroSubtitle.en-US: Amplify is unlike any other business solutions provider. The biggest difference? We become a partner.
The power of a CRM is its ability to curate the patterns and insights that align with its target audience.

heroTitle.en-US: Realize the power of proactive data insights.

heroSubtitle.en-US: Start to make data-driven decisions for your business and see the difference for yourself.
If you are interested in amplifying your business’ potential with through CRM or analytics, it all starts here.

thankYouContent.en-US: We appreciate your consideration. We will be in touch as soon as we can.

contactUsSubtitle.en-US: Like what you’re seeing? Get in touch with us so we can talk about amplifying your business.

subtitle.en-US: Since 2018, we’ve been working with businesses of all sizes to amplify their sales, margins and satisfaction through the use of customized CRM and business intelligence solutions.

address.en-US: 200-1460 Chevrier Blvd. Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Y6 Canada

subtitle.en-US: The capabilities, integrations and functionality of Dynamics 365 are moving at a rapid pace. Finding the internal resources to keep up with this technology is difficult. This is our expertise and we are ready to help manage this for you, so that you can take advantage of the growing benefits of the platform while continuing your focus on your business.

question.en-US: Success in managing and enhancing Dynamics 365 involves:

content.value: Amplify has a built-in tool within your Dynamics environment to easily make requests and view updates while working in the system.
We schedule regular, recurring meetings with designated stakeholders to ensure our development priorities and pace are aligned and being communicated effectively.

We also include a recurring planning meeting where we take a step back, analyze our progress at a higher level, review our shared goals and come well prepared with our suggestions and the latest relevant technology updates.

cmsName.en-US: Home Page: Switch to other CRM

title.en-US: We’re looking to switch from our current CRM.

subtitle.en-US: There can be multiple reasons why you might be re-evaluating your current CRM; increased costs, integration issues with other systems, limited functionality or difficulties with your current development partners. We have helped clients in all of these scenarios successfully migrate to Dynamics 365 to solve their CRM challenges.

content.value: Office 365 and other Microsoft apps fully integrate with many features continually being added.
Add departments and apps as you grow, it is meant to run your entire business.
Built better data for valuable insights through Power BI.
Priced significantly lower in market for system capabilities and features.
Get your company positioned on a system you’ll never have to switch from in the future.

cmsName.en-US: CRM Page: How CRM Helps Video

subtitle.en-US: A CRM platform helps companies target different audiences, set scores and alerts based on an individual lead or customer’s activity, proactively work with contacts, and maintain relationships. Best of all, a CRM system can be used across departments to ensure that all customer-facing teams are empowered with the right data to create incredible customer experiences.

mainText.en-US: Microsoft is the only vendor that provides hardware, software, and internet-of-things (IoT) platforms to enable end-to-end customer service.

content.value: Dynamics 365 is a collection of intelligent business applications that work together to run your business within one unified platform, helping drive consistency and efficiency.

Dynamics 365 is scalable – while it continues to excel in its core areas of sales process management and finance it also provides exceptional marketing, service, human resource and operations applications as well that can be layered in to create a complete business management solution.
